<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 574]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(9.8 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 9.8 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 603, 220, 618]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 619, 730, 651]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[500, 282, 922, 300]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
An electric heater uses a resistance wire of resistance \(26\Omega\). The power dissipated in the resistance wire is \(2500 \text{W}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 117, 144, 136]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 117, 514, 136]]<|/det|>
Calculate the current in the resistance wire.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[505, 297, 920, 316]]<|/det|>
<form>current = .................................................... [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 329, 146, 348]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 327, 920, 363]]<|/det|>
The resistance wire of the heater has a length of \(1.2 \text{m}\) and a cross-sectional area of \(7.9 \times 10^{- 7} \text{m}^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 374, 920, 408]]<|/det|>
A new heater is designed using wire of the same material with length \(1.8 \text{m}\) and cross-sectional area \(5.8 \times 10^{- 7} \text{m}^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 420, 457, 439]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[479, 600, 920, 620]]<|/det|>
<form>resistance = .................................................... [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 632, 144, 651]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 631, 915, 650]]<|/det|>
The 2500 W heater is used in a country where electricity costs 0.30 dollars per kilowatt-hour.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 662, 683, 681]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[529, 842, 920, 861]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 873, 920, 892]]<|/det|>
